00010 #include "Jamoma.h"
00011 
00012 #define MAX_NUM_CHANNELS 16
00013 
00014 
00015 // Data Structure for this object
00016 typedef struct _fade{                                   // Data Structure for this object
00017         t_pxobject                      x_obj;
00018         void                            *obex;
00019         tt_crossfade            *xfade;                 // crossfade object from the TapTools library
00020         long                            attr_shape;
00021         long                            attr_mode;
00022         float                           attr_position;
00023         short                           num_chans;
00024         tt_audio_signal         *signal_in[3];
00025         tt_audio_signal         *signal_out;
00026 } t_fade;
00027 
00028 // Prototypes for methods
00029 void *fade_new(t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv);                           // New Object Creation Method
00030 t_int *fade_perform1(t_int *w);                                                                         // An MSP Perform (signal) Method
00031 t_int *fade_perform2(t_int *w);                                                                         // An MSP Perform (signal) Method
00032 void fade_dsp(t_fade *x, t_signal **sp, short *count);                          // DSP Method
00033 void fade_assist(t_fade *x, void *b, long m, long a, char *s);          // Assistance Method
00034 void fade_float(t_fade *x, double value );                                                      // Float Method
00035 void fade_free(t_fade *x);
00036 t_max_err attr_set_position(t_fade *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00037 t_max_err attr_set_shape(t_fade *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00038 t_max_err attr_set_mode(t_fade *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00039 t_int *fade_perform_stereo_1(t_int *w);
00040 t_int *fade_perform_stereo_2(t_int *w);
00041 
00042 // Globals
00043 t_class         *fade_class;            // Required. Global pointing to this class
00044 t_symbol        *ps_float32;
00045 t_symbol        *ps_long;
00046 t_symbol        *ps_dumpout;
00047 
00048 
00049 /************************************************************************************/
00050 // Main() Function
00051 
00052 int main(void)                          // main recieves a copy of the Max function macros table
00053 {
00054         long attrflags = 0;
00055         t_class *c;
00056         t_object *attr;
00057         
00058         jamoma_init();
00059         ps_float32 = gensym("float32");
00060         ps_long = gensym("long");
00061         ps_dumpout = gensym("dumpout");
00062 
00063         // Define our class
00064         c = class_new("jcom.xfade~",(method)fade_new, (method)fade_free, (short)sizeof(t_fade), 
00065                 (method)0L, A_GIMME, 0);
00066         class_obexoffset_set(c, calcoffset(t_fade, obex));
00067 
00068         // Make methods accessible for our class: 
00069         class_addmethod(c, (method)fade_float,                          "float", A_FLOAT, 0L);
00070         class_addmethod(c, (method)fade_dsp,                            "dsp", A_CANT, 0L);
00071     class_addmethod(c, (method)object_obex_dumpout,     "dumpout", A_CANT,0);  
00072     class_addmethod(c, (method)object_obex_quickref,    "quickref", A_CANT, 0);
00073     class_addmethod(c, (method)fade_assist,                     "assist", A_CANT, 0L);
00074 
00075         // Add attributes to our class:
00076         attr = attr_offset_new("shape", ps_long, attrflags,
00077                 (method)0L,(method)attr_set_shape, calcoffset(t_fade, attr_shape));
00078         class_addattr(c, attr);
00079         
00080         attr = attr_offset_new("mode", ps_long, attrflags,
00081                 (method)0L,(method)attr_set_mode, calcoffset(t_fade, attr_mode));
00082         class_addattr(c, attr);
00083         
00084         attr = attr_offset_new("position", ps_float32, attrflags,
00085                 (method)0L,(method)attr_set_position, calcoffset(t_fade, attr_position));
00086         class_addattr(c, attr); 
00087         
00088         // Setup our class to work with MSP
00089         class_dspinit(c);
00090 
00091         // Finalize our class
00092         class_register(CLASS_BOX, c);
00093         fade_class = c;
00094         return 0;
00095 }

00098 /************************************************************************************/
00099 // Object Life
00100 
00101 // Create
00102 void *fade_new(t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00103 {
00104         long attrstart = attr_args_offset(argc, argv);          // support normal arguments
00105         short i;
00106         
00107         t_fade *x = (t_fade *)object_alloc(fade_class);
00108         if(x){
00109                 object_obex_store((void *)x, ps_dumpout, (object *)outlet_new(x, NULL));        // dumpout
00110 
00111                 x->num_chans = 1;
00112                 if(attrstart && argv){
00113                         int argument = atom_getlong(argv);
00114                         x->num_chans = tt_audio_base::clip(argument, 1, MAX_NUM_CHANNELS);
00115                 }
00116 
00117                 dsp_setup((t_pxobject *)x, (x->num_chans * 2) + 1);     // Create Object and N Inlets (last argument)
00118                 x->x_obj.z_misc = Z_NO_INPLACE;                                         // ESSENTIAL!                   
00119                 for(i=0; i< (x->num_chans); i++)
00120                         outlet_new((t_pxobject *)x, "signal");                  // Create a signal Outlet               
00121                 
00122                 x->xfade = new tt_crossfade;                                            // Constructors
00123                 x->signal_out = new tt_audio_signal;
00124                 for(i=0; i<3; i++){
00125                         x->signal_in[i] = new tt_audio_signal;
00126                 }
00127                 
00128                 x->xfade->set_attr(tt_crossfade::k_mode, 0);            // defaults
00129                 x->xfade->set_attr(tt_crossfade::k_shape, 0);
00130                 x->xfade->set_attr(tt_crossfade::k_position, 0.5);
00131 
00132                 attr_args_process(x, argc, argv);                                       // handle attribute args                                
00133         }
00134         return (x);                                                                                             // Return the pointer
00135 }
00136 
00137 // Destroy
00138 void fade_free(t_fade *x)
00139 {
00140         short i;
00141         
00142         dsp_free((t_pxobject *)x);                                      // Always call dsp_free first in this routine
00143         delete x->xfade;
00144         delete x->signal_out;
00145         for(i=0; i<3; i++){
00146                 delete x->signal_in[i];
00147         }
00148 }
00149 
00150 /************************************************************************************/
00151 // Methods bound to input/inlets
00152 
00153 // Method for Assistance Messages
00154 void fade_assist(t_fade *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst)
00155 {
00156         if(msg==1){     // Inlets
00157                 if(arg < x->num_chans) strcpy(dst, "(signal) Input A");
00158                 else if(arg < x->num_chans*2) strcpy(dst, "(signal) Input B");
00159                 else strcpy(dst, "(float/signal) Crossfade Position");
00160         }
00161         else if(msg==2){ // Outlets
00162                 if(arg < x->num_chans) strcpy(dst, "(signal) Crossfaded between A and B");
00163                 else strcpy(dst, "dumpout");
00164         }
00165 }
00166 
00167 
00168 // Float Method
00169 void fade_float(t_fade *x, double value)
00170 {
00171         x->attr_position = value;
00172         x->xfade->set_attr(tt_crossfade::k_position, value);
00173 }
00174 
00175 
00176 // ATTRIBUTE: position
00177 t_max_err attr_set_position(t_fade *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00178 {
00179         x->attr_position = atom_getfloat(argv);
00180         x->xfade->set_attr(tt_crossfade::k_position, x->attr_position);
00181 
00182         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00183         #pragma unused(attr)
00184 }
00185 
00186 
00187 // ATTRIBUTE: shape
00188 t_max_err attr_set_shape(t_fade *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00189 {
00190         x->attr_shape = atom_getlong(argv);
00191         if(x->attr_shape == 0) x->xfade->set_attr(tt_crossfade::k_shape, tt_crossfade::k_shape_equalpower);
00192         else x->xfade->set_attr(tt_crossfade::k_shape, tt_crossfade::k_shape_linear);
00193 
00194         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00195         #pragma unused(attr)
00196 }
00197 
00198 
00199 // ATTRIBUTE: mode
00200 t_max_err attr_set_mode(t_fade *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00201 {
00202         x->attr_mode = atom_getlong(argv);
00203         if(x->attr_mode == 0) x->xfade->set_attr(tt_crossfade::k_mode, tt_crossfade::k_mode_lookup);
00204         else x->xfade->set_attr(tt_crossfade::k_mode, tt_crossfade::k_mode_calculate);
00205 
00206         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00207         #pragma unused(attr)
00208 }
00209 
00210 
00211 // control rate fading
00212 t_int *fade_perform1(t_int *w)
00213 {
00214         t_fade *x = (t_fade *)(w[1]);                                           // Pointer
00215         x->signal_in[0]->set_vector((t_float *)(w[2]));         // Input Dry
00216         x->signal_in[1]->set_vector((t_float *)(w[3]));         // Input Wet
00217         x->signal_out->set_vector((t_float *)(w[4]));           // Output
00218         x->signal_in[0]->set_vectorsize((int)(w[5]));           // Vector Size
00219 
00220         if(!(x->x_obj.z_disabled))
00221                 x->xfade->dsp_vector_calc(x->signal_in[0], x->signal_in[1], x->signal_out);
00222 
00223         return(w+6);
00224 }
00225 
00226 
00227 // signal rate fading
00228 t_int *fade_perform2(t_int *w)
00229 {
00230         t_fade *x = (t_fade *)(w[1]);                                           // Pointer
00231         x->signal_in[0]->set_vector((t_float *)(w[2]));         // Input Dry
00232         x->signal_in[1]->set_vector((t_float *)(w[3]));         // Input Wet
00233         x->signal_in[2]->set_vector((t_float *)(w[4]));         // Input Control
00234         x->signal_out->set_vector((t_float *)(w[5]));           // Output
00235         x->signal_in[0]->set_vectorsize((int)(w[6]));           // Vector Size
00236 
00237         if(!(x->x_obj.z_disabled)){
00238                 x->xfade->set_attr(tt_crossfade::k_position, *x->signal_in[2]->vector); // automated at vector-rate rather than the sample-rate
00239                 x->xfade->dsp_vector_calc(x->signal_in[0], x->signal_in[1], x->signal_out);
00240         }
00241         return(w+7);            // Return a pointer to the NEXT object in the DSP call chain
00242 }
00243 
00244 
00245 // DSP Method
00246 void fade_dsp(t_fade *x, t_signal **sp, short *count)
00247 {
00248         short i;
00249 
00250         // determine if a signal is being used to drive the crossfade position
00251         if(count[x->num_chans * 2]){                    // SIGNAL RATE CROSSFADE CONNECTED
00252                 for(i=0; i < x->num_chans; i++)         //add an instance of the perform method for each channel
00253                         dsp_add(fade_perform2, 6, 
00254                                 x, 
00255                                 sp[i]->s_vec, 
00256                                 sp[i + x->num_chans]->s_vec, 
00257                                 sp[x->num_chans * 2]->s_vec, 
00258                                 sp[i + (x->num_chans * 2) + 1]->s_vec, 
00259                                 sp[i]->s_n 
00260                         );
00261         }
00262         else{                                                                   // CONTROL RATE CROSSFADE
00263                 for(i=0; i < x->num_chans; i++)         //add an instance of the perform method for each channel
00264                         dsp_add(fade_perform1, 5, 
00265                                 x, 
00266                                 sp[i]->s_vec, 
00267                                 sp[i + x->num_chans]->s_vec, 
00268                                 sp[i + (x->num_chans * 2) + 1]->s_vec, 
00269                                 sp[i]->s_n 
00270                         );
00271         }
00272 }
